meanings.definition: Saladangs (noun): a type of Thai fruit knife with a curved blade.
meanings.sent1: I used a saladangs to slice the ripe mango.
meanings.sent2: The chef's saladangs gleamed under the kitchen lights.
meanings.sent3: The saladangs was so sharp, it could easily slice through a watermelon.
meanings.sent4: Her precision with the saladangs was like a skilled artist with a paintbrush.
meanings.sent5: The unique design of the saladangs made it stand out among other kitchen tools.

meanings.definition: Saladangs (verb): to cut fruit or vegetables using a saladangs knife.
meanings.sent1: She carefully saladangs the papaya into thin slices.
meanings.sent2: In the market, vendors saladangs various fruits for customers.
meanings.sent3: He saladangs the cucumber with such finesse, it looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The way she saladangs the apples reminded me of a graceful dance.
meanings.sent5: Using the saladangs, he effortlessly transformed the watermelon into bite-sized pieces.
